actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 756, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Luna amendment No. 43.
An amendment, offered by Mrs. Luna,  numbered 43 printed in Part B of House Report 118-242 to reduce the salary of Michael Connor, Assistant Secretary of the Army for Civil Works, to $1.
On agreeing to the Lamborn amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 756, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Lamborn amendment No. 42.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Lamborn,  numbered 42 printed in Part B of House Report 118-242 to prohibit funds from this act from granting access of citizens from countries on the sensitive countries list to non-public areas of National Security Laboratories.
On agreeing to the Jackson (TX) amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 756, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Jackson (TX) amendment No. 41.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Jackson (TX),  numbered 41 printed in Part B of House Report 118-242 to prohibit NNSA from halting construction on the HE Synthesis, Formulation, and Production facility at the Pantex Plant.
On agreeing to the Hageman amendment; Failed by recorded vote: (Roll no. 546).
On agreeing to the Garamendi amendment; Failed by recorded vote: (Roll no. 545).
On agreeing to the Garamendi amendment; Failed by recorded vote: (Roll no. 544).
On agreeing to the Perry amendment; Failed by recorded vote: (Roll no. 543).
On agreeing to the Perry amendment; Failed by recorded vote: (Roll no. 542).
On agreeing to the Perry amendment; Failed by recorded vote: (Roll no. 541).
On agreeing to the Perry amendment; Failed by recorded vote: (Roll no. 540).
On agreeing to the Perry amendment; Failed by recorded vote: (Roll no. 539).
On agreeing to the Perry amendment; Failed by recorded vote: (Roll no. 538).
On agreeing to the Perry amendment; Failed by recorded vote: (Roll no. 537).
On agreeing to the Perry amendment; Failed by recorded vote: (Roll no. 536).
On agreeing to the Norman amendment; Failed by recorded vote: (Roll no. 535).
On agreeing to the Perry amendment; Failed by recorded vote: (Roll no. 534).
On agreeing to the Roy amendment; Failed by recorded vote: (Roll no. 533).
On agreeing to the Griffith amendment; Failed by recorded vote: (Roll no. 532).
On agreeing to the Westerman amendment; Failed by recorded vote: (Roll no. 531).
On agreeing to the Neguse amendment; Agreed to by recorded vote: (Roll no. 530).
On agreeing to the Perry amendment; Failed by recorded vote: (Roll no. 529).
The Chair announced that the unfinished business was the question on agreeing to the amendments to H.R. 4394, which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
On agreeing to the Hageman amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 756, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Hageman amendment No. 40.

An amendment, offered by Ms. Hageman,  numbered 40 printed in Part B of House Report 118-242 to prohibit the use of funds to finalize, implement, or enforce rulemaking pertaining to energy conservation standards for consumer water heaters.

At the conclusion of debate on the Hageman amendment No. 39, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amemdment and by voice vote announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Fleischmann demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 756, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Hageman amendment No. 39.
An amendment, offered by Ms. Hageman,  numbered 39 printed in Part B of House Report 118-242 to prohibit any funding from going towards the SuperTruck III program at DOE.
On agreeing to the Hageman amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 756, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Hageman amendment No. 38.
An amendment, offered by Ms. Hageman,  numbered 38 printed in Part B of House Report 118-242 to prohibit funds for DOE's implementation of their proposed Industrial Decarbonization Roadmap.

At the conclusion of debate on the Garamendi amendment No. 37, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amemdment and by voice vote announced that the noes had prevailed. Mr. Garamendi demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 756, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Garamendi amendment No. 37.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Garamendi,  numbered 37 printed in Part B of House Report 118-242 to prohibit funds for the W87-1 modification program to enable additional analysis of the underlying program justifications, planning and budget.

At the conclusion of debate on the Garamendi amendment No. 36, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amemdment and by voice vote announced that the noes had prevailed. Mr. Garamendi demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 756, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Garamendi amendment No. 36.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Garamendi,  numbered 36 printed in Part B of House Report 118-242 to prohibit funding for plutonium pit production at the Savannah River Plutonium Processing Facility.
The House resolved into Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union for further consideration.
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 4394 â€” "Making appropriations for energy and water development and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2024, and for other purposes."
The House resumed with one minute speeches.

actions-list.header: NOTICE OF INTENT TO OFFER RESOLUTION
actions-list.actionItem: Ms. Greene (GA) notified the House of her intent to offer a privileged resolution pursuant to clause 2(a)(1) of rule IX. The Chair announced that a determination will be made at the time designated for consideration of the resolution.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The Chair designated Ms. Titus to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by Reverend John Matthews, Grace Lutheran Church, Apple Valley, Minnesota.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
